diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute phosphate nephropathy due to ingestion of oral sodium phosphate solution
differential_diagnosis: Acute tubular necrosis due to dehydration
Acute interstitial nephritis due to proton-pump inhibitors
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acute phosphate nephropathy was made due to a history of recent colonoscopy preparation with oral sodium phosphate solution, resulting in acute kidney injury. Laboratory findings and renal biopsy showed acute tubular injury consistent with phosphate nephropathy, while alternative diagnoses such as prerenal azotemia and acute tubular necrosis were ruled out based on urine studies and imaging results.
